case_title: Seth HUSSAIN BHA vs MUHAMMAD IQBAL AND 2 others
complaint_summary: The appellant entered into a partnership with the respondents to run a kerosene agency in Chaman under a partnership deed dated July 3, 1955. The appellant alleged mismanagement by the respondents, leading to the cancellation of the agency in 1960. He demanded accounts and filed a suit for dissolution of the firm and settlement of accounts.
investigation_summary: The appellant audited the firm's accounts through his employee and chartered accountants, but the respondents contested the findings. The trial court ruled in favor of the appellant, but the District Court reversed the decision, dismissing the suit.
judgment_summary: The High Court upheld the District Court's decision, finding that the partnership was formed for a single venture (Chaman agency) and was automatically dissolved upon the termination of the agency. The suit for accounts was deemed not maintainable as the applicant had access to all account books and knew his claim. The suit was also barred by limitation under Article 106 of the Limitation Act.
legal_arguments: The appellant argued the partnership was a general partnership and not limited to the Chaman agency.
The appellant contended the suit for accounts was maintainable despite possession of account books.
The respondents argued the partnership was for a single venture and dissolved automatically upon the agency's cancellation.
The respondents claimed the suit was time-barred under the Limitation Act.

witness_statement.Mr. Qureshi: Audited the firm's accounts as an employee of the appellant.

key_issues: Nature of partnership (partnership-at-will vs. partnership for a single venture)
Limitation under Article 106 of the Limitation Act

maxims.Ex hypothesi: A partnership confined to a particular class of adventures ends automatically with the termination of those adventures.

legal_terms.Partnership-at-will: A partnership that continues as long as the partners desire.
legal_terms.Particular partnership: A partnership formed for a specific venture or undertaking.

words_and_phrases.Adventures: A pecuniary risk, venture, or commercial enterprise.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around the dissolution of a partnership formed for a specific venture. The appellant's claim for accounts was dismissed as time-barred, and the court emphasized the automatic dissolution of the partnership upon the termination of the venture.

facts.business_purpose: Agency for kerosene in Chaman from Standard Vacuum Oil Company
facts.appellant_claim: Dissolution of partnership and settlement of accounts

trial_court_decision.result: Suit decreed in favor of the applicant

district_court_decision.finding: Partnership was for a single venture; suit barred by limitation

finding: Applicant had access to all account books and knew his claim
Partnership was for a single venture (Chaman agency)
Suit barred under Article 106 of the Limitation Act
